trans-unit.source: Create a Media Services account | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a Media Services account | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Describes how to create a new Azure Media Services account in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Describes how to create a new Azure Media Services account in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Create an Azure Media Services account
trans-unit.target: Create an Azure Media Services account

trans-unit.source: The Azure portal provides a way to quickly create an Azure Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The Azure portal provides a way to quickly create an Azure Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: You can use your account to access Media Services that enable you to store, encrypt, encode, manage, and stream media content in Azure.
trans-unit.target: You can use your account to access Media Services that enable you to store, encrypt, encode, manage, and stream media content in Azure.

trans-unit.source: At the time you create a Media Services account, you also create an associated storage account (or use an existing one) in the same geographic region as the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: At the time you create a Media Services account, you also create an associated storage account (or use an existing one) in the same geographic region as the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: This article explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new Media Services account and then associate it with a storage account.
trans-unit.target: This article explains how to use the Quick Create method to create a new Media Services account and then associate it with a storage account.

trans-unit.source: Concepts
trans-unit.target: Concepts

trans-unit.source: Accessing Media Services requires two associated accounts:
trans-unit.target: Accessing Media Services requires two associated accounts:

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Your account gives you access to a set of cloud-based Media Services that are available in Azure.
trans-unit.target: Your account gives you access to a set of cloud-based Media Services that are available in Azure.

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account does not store actual media content.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account does not store actual media content.

trans-unit.source: Instead it stores metadata about the media content and media processing jobs in your account.
trans-unit.target: Instead it stores metadata about the media content and media processing jobs in your account.

trans-unit.source: At the time you create the account, you select an available Media Services region.
trans-unit.target: At the time you create the account, you select an available Media Services region.

trans-unit.source: The region you select is a data center that stores the metadata records for your account.
trans-unit.target: The region you select is a data center that stores the metadata records for your account.

trans-unit.source: Available Media Services regions include the following: North Europe, West Europe, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, East Asia, Japan West, Japan East.
trans-unit.target: Available Media Services regions include the following: North Europe, West Europe, West US, East US, Southeast Asia, East Asia, Japan West, Japan East.

trans-unit.source: Media Services does not use affinity groups.
trans-unit.target: Media Services does not use affinity groups.

trans-unit.source: An associated storage account.
trans-unit.target: An associated storage account.

trans-unit.source: Your storage account is an Azure storage account that is associated with your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: Your storage account is an Azure storage account that is associated with your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: The storage account provides blob storage for media files, and must be located in the same geographic region as the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: The storage account provides blob storage for media files, and must be located in the same geographic region as the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: When you create a Media Services account, you can either choose an existing storage account in the same region, or you can create a new storage account in the same region.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Media Services account, you can either choose an existing storage account in the same region, or you can create a new storage account in the same region.

trans-unit.source: If you delete a Media Services account, the blobs in your related storage account are not deleted.
trans-unit.target: If you delete a Media Services account, the blobs in your related storage account are not deleted.

trans-unit.source: Create a Media Services account using Quick Create
trans-unit.target: Create a Media Services account using Quick Create

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal[], click New, click Media Service, and then click Quick Create.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal[], click New, click Media Service, and then click Quick Create.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Media Services Quick Create</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Media Services Quick Create</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In NAME, enter the name of the new account.
trans-unit.target: In NAME, enter the name of the new account.

trans-unit.source: A Media Services account name is all lowercase numbers or letters with no spaces, and is 3 to 24 characters in length.
trans-unit.target: A Media Services account name is all lowercase numbers or letters with no spaces, and is 3 to 24 characters in length.

trans-unit.source: In REGION, select the geographic region that will be used to store the metadata records for your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: In REGION, select the geographic region that will be used to store the metadata records for your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: Only the available Media Services regions appear in the drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: Only the available Media Services regions appear in the drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: In STORAGE ACCOUNT, select a storage account to provide blob storage of the media content from your Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: In STORAGE ACCOUNT, select a storage account to provide blob storage of the media content from your Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: You can select an existing storage account in the same geographic region as your Media Services account, or you can create a new storage account.
trans-unit.target: You can select an existing storage account in the same geographic region as your Media Services account, or you can create a new storage account.

trans-unit.source: A new storage account is created in the same region.
trans-unit.target: A new storage account is created in the same region.

trans-unit.source: If you created a new storage account, in NEW STORAGE ACCOUNT NAME, enter a name for the storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you created a new storage account, in NEW STORAGE ACCOUNT NAME, enter a name for the storage account.

trans-unit.source: The rules for storage account names are the same as for Media Services accounts.
trans-unit.target: The rules for storage account names are the same as for Media Services accounts.

trans-unit.source: Click Quick Create at the bottom of the form.
trans-unit.target: Click Quick Create at the bottom of the form.

trans-unit.source: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.
trans-unit.target: You can monitor the status of the process in the message area at the bottom of the window.

trans-unit.source: The status changes to Active when the account is successfully created.
trans-unit.target: The status changes to Active when the account is successfully created.

trans-unit.source: The media services page opens with the new account displayed.
trans-unit.target: The media services page opens with the new account displayed.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page, the MANAGE KEYS button appears.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page, the MANAGE KEYS button appears.

trans-unit.source: When you click this button, a page with the Media Services account name and the primary and secondary keys is displayed.
trans-unit.target: When you click this button, a page with the Media Services account name and the primary and secondary keys is displayed.

trans-unit.source: You will need the account name and the primary key information to programmatically access the Media Services account.
trans-unit.target: You will need the account name and the primary key information to programmatically access the Media Services account.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Media Services Page</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Media Services Page</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you double-click the account name, the Quick Start page is displayed by default.
trans-unit.target: When you double-click the account name, the Quick Start page is displayed by default.

trans-unit.source: This page enables you to do some management tasks that are also available on other pages of the portal.
trans-unit.target: This page enables you to do some management tasks that are also available on other pages of the portal.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can upload a video file from this page, or do it from the CONTENT page.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can upload a video file from this page, or do it from the CONTENT page.

trans-unit.source: In addition, you can view code that uses the Azure Media Services SDK to accomplish the following tasks: upload, encode, and publish videos.
trans-unit.target: In addition, you can view code that uses the Azure Media Services SDK to accomplish the following tasks: upload, encode, and publish videos.

trans-unit.source: You can click one of the links under the WRITE SOME CODE section, copy the code and use it in your application.
trans-unit.target: You can click one of the links under the WRITE SOME CODE section, copy the code and use it in your application.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
